Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of a Decision Aid and Motivational Interviewing for Knee Osteoarthritis

Trial_Design.evidence: In a two-group randomised controlled trial

Participants.evidence: 493 black adults aged ≥50 with moderate to severe knee OA were enrolled from urban primary care clinics

Intervention.evidence: randomised to receive either a decision-aid video and motivational interviewing or an educational booklet on OA

Objective.evidence: This study evaluated whether a decision aid and motivational interviewing improve referrals to orthopaedic surgery and willingness to undergo TKA.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was referral to orthopaedic surgery at 12 months.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Of 493 randomised, 253 were in the control group and 240 in the treatment group.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Referral rates were 36% in the control group and 32% in the treatment group (OR, 0.81; 95% CI, 0.56–1.18; p = 0.277).
